metadata.title: CVE-2020-36788 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/nouveau: avoid a use-after-free when BO init fails nouveau_bo_init() isbacked by ttm_bo_init() and ferries its return code back to the caller. Onfailures, ttm_bo_init() invokes the provided destructor which shouldde-initialize and free the memory. Thus, when nouveau_bo_init() returns anerror the gem object has already been released and the memory freed bynouveau_bo_del_ttm().

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-36788` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic - 6.8.0-31.31
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-generic-64k - 6.8.0-31.31
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1008-aws - 6.8.0-1008.8
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-azure - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1007-gcp - 6.8.0-1007.7
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency - 6.8.0-31.31.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-31-lowlatency-64k - 6.8.0-31.31.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle - 6.8.0-1005.5
linux-image-unsigned-6.8.0-1005-oracle-64k - 6.8.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-6.8.0-1004-raspi - 6.8.0-1004.4
No subscription required
